framework

Interface IPiece

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IShield, IWeapon

    public interface IPiece
    Interface to be implemented by classes that represent pieces (either weapons or shields)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double getHealth()
      Get the current health of the piece
      java.lang.String getName()
      Get the name of the piece
      int getOwner()
      Get the number of the player who owns the piece
      double getRadius()
      Get the radius of the piece
      double getXPos()
      Get the x coordinate of the piece
      double getYPos()
      Get the y coordinate of the piece
      IProjectile onImpact(IImpact impact)
      Method to be called by the game engine when a projectile hits this piece This method should not be called in code written by the student.
      void onSuccessfulMove(double x, double y)
      Method to be called by the game engine when a piece has been successfully moved to a new position.

    • Method Detail

      • getOwner

        int getOwner()
        Get the number of the player who owns the piece
        Returns:
        number of the player who owns the piece

      • getHealth

        double getHealth()
        Get the current health of the piece
        Returns:
        a value between 0 and 100 representing the health of the piece

      • getXPos

        double getXPos()
        Get the x coordinate of the piece
        Returns:
        x coordinate of the centre of the piece, expressed in game coordinates

      • getYPos

        double getYPos()
        Get the y coordinate of the piece
        Returns:
        y coordinate of the centre of the piece, expressed in game coordinates

      • getRadius

        double getRadius()
        Get the radius of the piece
        Returns:
        radius of the piece, expressed in game coordinates

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Get the name of the piece
        Returns:
        the name of the piece (this can be used to identify pieces when displaying them)

      • onImpact

        IProjectile onImpact(IImpact impact)
        Method to be called by the game engine when a projectile hits this piece This method should not be called in code written by the student.
        Parameters:
        impact - object representing the impact of the incoming projectile
        Returns:
        object representing the outgoing projectile. This should not be the same as the object representing the incoming projectile

      • onSuccessfulMove

        void onSuccessfulMove(double x,
                    double y)
        Method to be called by the game engine when a piece has been successfully moved to a new position. The method should be implemented so that the x and y coordinates are replaced by those specified in the parameters to this method. This method is called by the game engine, after it has checked that a move is valid. It should not be called in code written by students
        Parameters:
        x - new x coordinate for piece, in game coordinates
        y - new y coordinate for piece, in game coordinates
